content: @Paul Knapp reading this, I'm confused. These 2 statements seem contradictory:

• The expected Track testing will be via HTTP POST Request-Response with the resource, or exchangeable content in the body of the HTTP content.
  • The FHIR Client will construct a Eligibility resource. To obtain the EligibilityResponse for the submitted resource via FHIR REST the client with perform a GET on EligibilityResponse with search parameters which may be expected to select the intended response
not that I know what "or exchangeable content in the body" means, or what the client does with it's eligibility resource.

then for this:

  • The FHIR Client will construct a Claim resource indicating Pre-Authorization. The service will respond with a ClaimResponse indicating only receipt not adjudication of the Claim (Pre-Authorization).
where does the claim resource go? Post to where?
also, can you ask Benoit to sign up here please

@Grahame Grieve I think there are three questions here:
1) The exchangeable content is the Resource (EligibilityRequest or Bundle containing an EligibilityRequest) - there are being moved from straight HTTP to a $submit operation after this connectathon (isn't sufficient time to implement for this connectathon).
2) What does the client do with its EligibilityRequest resource? Typically persist it in some manner.
3) Where does the Claim resource go? It would be POSTed to the insurer.
Sure, I'll be speaking with Benoit later today.
from straight HTTP... a POST to somewhere? anywhere?
the others - maybe the doco could be improved
This will be the Zulip topic for the Financial Track (and the KSA Financial Track) beginning with Connectathon 25
We are starting an orientation session of the Financial Track now, 3PM eastern. But will redo at the start of the KSA and North American sessions on Thursday.

Hello everyone,

@Paul Knapp is a link for the Financial Track on Whova ? I missed the introduction session, and want to make sure I attend this coming one please.
